# Description of DataSchema variable

The description of harmonised variable is the following:

* Short name: `living_status`
* Variable label: `Living status`
* Variable description: `The individual is dead or alive?`
* Domain: `Death`
* Value type: `categorical`
* Category coding:

**Code** | **Category Label**
-------- | ------------------
0        | alive
1        | Dead
2        | Dropout  

* Category missings: 

**Code** | **Category Label**
----| ------------------
991 | CAPI/interviewer error
992 | Impute
993 | Disable to measure
994 | Not attempt/not done
995 | Does not answer
996 | Not applicable
997 | Refuse
998 | Do not know
999 | Missing

```{r lab, echo=FALSE}
ds_label <- "Living status"
ds_label_all <- "The individual is dead or alive?"
```


# Data process

## SHARE

### Wave 1 

```{r assign1, echo=FALSE}
opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'SHARE_id_w1','SHARE.sharew1_rel2-6-0_gv_weights',
                         variables=list('hhid'), missings = TRUE)
SHARE_id_w1 <- opal.execute(o,'SHARE_id_w1')
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm
It's considered that at baseline all the individuals are alive. Therefore it is going to compute the variable with all the values as 0. 

**R script:**

```{r harmo1}
SHARE_ds_w1 <- tibble(id=SHARE_id_w1$id)
SHARE_ds_w1$living_status <- 0
SHARE_ds_w1$living_status <- labelled(SHARE_ds_w1$living_status, labels = c("Alive"=0, "Dead"=1, "Dropout"=2, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

#### Statistics of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript1, echo=F}
vari <- SHARE_ds_w1$living_status
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vari, missing_values = c(991, 992, 993, 994, 995, 996, 997, 998, 999))$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(SHARE_ds_w1, aes(x=factor(living_status))) + geom_bar(stat="count", width=0.4, fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency") 
```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute the harmonized variable it have to recode: 

* `the individuals include in wave 2 dataset as 0 'alive' `
* `the individuals with a value in year of death posterior to the date of interview into 1 'death'`

**R script:**

```{r harmo2}

SHARE_ls <- car::recode(SHARE_ls, "999=NA; 998=NA; 997=NA")

LS <- function(Mdeath, Ydeath, Minterview, Yinterview, min_year_inter){
  D <- data.frame(Mdeath, Ydeath, Minterview, Yinterview)
  D$liv_stat <- NA
  id1 <- which(is.na(Ydeath) & is.na(Yinterview))
  D$liv_stat[id1] <- 999
  
  id2 <- which(is.na(Ydeath) & !is.na(Yinterview))
  D$liv_stat[id2] <- 0
  
  id3 <- which(!is.na(Ydeath) & is.na(Yinterview))
  id3_1 <- id3[which(D$Ydeath[id3]<min_year_inter)]
  D$liv_stat[id3_1] <- 1
  id3_2 <- id3[which(D$Ydeath[id3]>=min_year_inter)] 
  D$liv_stat[id3_2] <- 0 #alive but don't be interviewed
  
  id4 <- which(!is.na(Ydeath) & !is.na(Yinterview))
  id4_1 <- id4[which(D$Ydeath[id4]>D$Yinterview[id4])]
  D$liv_stat[id4_1] <- 0
  id4_2 <- id4[which(D$Ydeath[id4]==D$Yinterview[id4])]
  id4_2_1 <- id4_2[which(D$Mdeath[id4_2]>=D$Minterview[id4_2])]
  D$liv_stat[id4_2_1] <- 0
  id4_2_2 <- id4_2[which(D$Mdeath[id4_2]<D$Minterview[id4_2])]
  D$liv_stat[id4_2_2] <- 1
  id4_3 <- id4[which(D$Ydeath[id4]<D$Yinterview[id4])]
  D$liv_stat[id4_3] <- 1
  
  D$liv_stat
}

SHARE_ls2 <- cbind(SHARE_ls, liv_stat=LS(Mdeath=SHARE_ls$mdeath, 
                                       Ydeath=SHARE_ls$ydeath, 
                                       Minterview=SHARE_ls$mintw, 
                                       Yinterview=SHARE_ls$yintw, 
                                       min_year_inter=2011))



SHARE_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=SHARE_ls2$id)
SHARE_ds_w2$living_status <- car::recode(SHARE_ls2$liv_stat, "NA=999")
SHARE_ds_w2$living_status <- labelled(SHARE_ds_w2$living_status, labels = c("Alive"=0, "Dead"=1, "Dropout"=2, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

LS <- function(Mdeath, Ydeath, Minterview, Yinterview, min_year_inter){
  D <- data.frame(Mdeath, Ydeath, Minterview, Yinterview)

#### Harmonisation algorithm
To compute the harmonized variable it have to recode: 

* `the individuals include in wave 2 dataset as 0 'alive' `
* `the individuals with a value in year of death posterior to the date of interview into 1 'death'`


**R script:**

```{r harmo4}
SHARE_ls$mdeath <- car::recode(SHARE_ls$mdeath, "999=NA; 998=NA; 997=NA")
SHARE_ls$ydeath <- car::recode(SHARE_ls$ydeath, "999=NA; 998=NA; 997=NA")
SHARE_ls$mintw <- car::recode(SHARE_ls$mintw, "999=NA; 998=NA; 997=NA")
SHARE_ls$yintw <- car::recode(SHARE_ls$yintw, "999=NA; 998=NA; 997=NA")

LS <- function(Mdeath, Ydeath, Minterview, Yinterview, min_year_inter){
  D <- data.frame(Mdeath, Ydeath, Minterview, Yinterview)
  D$liv_stat <- NA
  id1 <- which(is.na(Ydeath) & is.na(Yinterview))
  D$liv_stat[id1] <- 999
  
  id2 <- which(is.na(Ydeath) & !is.na(Yinterview))
  D$liv_stat[id2] <- 0
  
  id3 <- which(!is.na(Ydeath) & is.na(Yinterview))
  id3_1 <- id3[which(D$Ydeath[id3]<min_year_inter)]
  D$liv_stat[id3_1] <- 1
  id3_2 <- id3[which(D$Ydeath[id3]>=min_year_inter)] 
  D$liv_stat[id3_2] <- 0 #alive but don't be interviewed
  
  id4 <- which(!is.na(Ydeath) & !is.na(Yinterview))
  id4_1 <- id4[which(D$Ydeath[id4]>D$Yinterview[id4])]
  D$liv_stat[id4_1] <- 0
  id4_2 <- id4[which(D$Ydeath[id4]==D$Yinterview[id4])]
  id4_2_1 <- id4_2[which(D$Mdeath[id4_2]>=D$Minterview[id4_2])]
  D$liv_stat[id4_2_1] <- 0
  id4_2_2 <- id4_2[which(D$Mdeath[id4_2]<D$Minterview[id4_2])]
  D$liv_stat[id4_2_2] <- 1
  id4_3 <- id4[which(D$Ydeath[id4]<D$Yinterview[id4])]
  D$liv_stat[id4_3] <- 1
  
  D$liv_stat
}

SHARE_ls2 <- cbind(SHARE_ls, liv_stat=LS(Mdeath=SHARE_ls$mdeath, 
                                       Ydeath=SHARE_ls$ydeath, 
                                       Minterview=SHARE_ls$mintw, 
                                       Yinterview=SHARE_ls$yintw, 
                                       min_year_inter=2013))

SHARE_ls2$liv_stat[which(SHARE_ls2$id %in% SHARE_id_w4$id)] <- 0

SHARE_ds_w4 <- tibble(id=SHARE_ls2$id)
SHARE_ds_w4$living_status <- car::recode(SHARE_ls2$liv_stat, "NA=999")
SHARE_ds_w4$living_status <- labelled(SHARE_ds_w4$living_status, labels = c("Alive"=0, "Dead"=1, "Dropout"=2, "Missing"=999, "Do not know"=998, "Refuse"=997, "Not applicable"=996, "Does not answer"=995,  "Not attempt not done"=994, "Disable to measure"=993, "Impute"=992, "CAPI interviewer error"=991))
```

# Quality estimation

Given that in SHARE study several countries participate but not all participate in all the waves, the "drop-out" 
category of the harmonized variable is not going to be taken into account (for each wave, we would not be able to differenciate 
those who really droped out from those who just did not participate in that particular wave).

In wave 3 there are individuals without neither date of death nor interview date that are recoded as missing (999).


```{r closeRsession, echo=FALSE}
opal.logout(o)
```
